DOC.brief_summary: This study ass efficacy safety QVA149 compare tiotropium plus formoterol patient moderate severe COPD .
DOC.brief_title: The Effect QVA149 Health Related Quality Life Patients With Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease ( COPD )
DOC.criteria: Male female adult age ≥ 40 yr Patients moderate severe chronic obstructive pulmonary disease ( GOLD 2010 guideline ) Smoking history least 10 pack year Postbronchodilator FEV1 < 80 % ≥30 % predict normal value postbronchodilator FEV1/FVC ( force vital capacity ) < 70 % Pregnant woman nurse mother woman childbearing potential use adequate contraception Patients history long QT syndrome Patients Type I uncontrolled Type II diabetes Patients COPD exacerbation respiratory tract infection within 6 week prior screen Patients history asthma Patients pulmonary lobectomy , lung volume reduction surgery , lung transplantation Patients concomitant pulmonary disease Patients require long term oxygen therapy ( > 15 h day ) Other protocoldefined inclusion/exclusion criterion may apply .
